content.question: Dr. Lofter is a professor of cognitive psychology at a university. He has been collecting data from student performances on tests throughout the school year. Every other test is formatted as either a fill-in-the-blank test, which relies on recall, or a multiple-choice test, which relies more on recognition. At the end of the year, Dr Lofter publishes the research findings in a journal on cognitive sciences showing how students perform better on recognition tests than recall tests. Which of the following ethical violations did Dr. Lofter commit?

choices.label: Dr. Lofter’s students did not give informed consent to be a part of the research.
Dr. Lofter did not protect his students from harm.
Dr. Lofter did not give any other researchers an opportunity to replicate the study.
Dr. Lofter should never use their own students as research subjects.

content.answer: Dr. Lofter’s students did not give informed consent to be a part of the research.

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
